DESCRIPTION: Farms, ranches, or other agricultural areas
Cut blocks or other forestry related activities
A building footprint or the building and the surrounding land related to mining activities
Drill pad features related to mineral exploration activities
Remote caches of fuel allowing for mineral exploration activities (will often have fuel tanks and barrels)
Pit or quarry for mining gravel or aggregate
Areas used to store materials and equipment for mining operations
Miscellaneous or unknown mining activities
Placer mining area with little disturbance
Placer mining area with greater disturbance
Quartz mining area with little disturbance
Quartz mining area with greater disturbance
Tailing pond associated with mining activity
Mining camp
Cleared area surrounding oil or gas well
PV added 2024-02-27
Any camp outside of mining areas, including fishing/hunting camps, ENV conservation officer cabins/camps, outfitters, etc.
Rural dwelling and associated land
Airport or Airstrip
Clearings that are related to transportation but could not be clearly attributed as a turn area, pullout, road cut and fill, etc.
Gravel pits related to transportation
An area associated with transportation and is intended as a vehicle pullout or turn area
Cut slopes and moved earth for road construction purposes
PV added 2023-11-28; Road Corridor
A tract of land devoid (or nearly devoid) of natural land cover and suspected to be anthropogenic in nature
A gravel pit with unknown related industry
Unable to identify from imagery, but suspected to be anthropogenic
Visible building or structure
Cemetery
Miscellaneous urban clearings
A turn area associated with transportation or road cul-de-sac
Barrier impounding water or stream
Recreational golfing area
Areas that are designated for industrial uses: factories, tank farm, transportation area
Any institutional buildings and immediate cleared area: School, government, etc.
Site used for disposal of waste materials
Standing body of water, created anthropogenically; includes sewage lagoons, wastewater facilities, and artificial bodies of water
Visible disturbance in Urban / Rural parks and recreation areas
Land use in which housing predominates in an urban or community setting
A tall structure, possibly used for communications or forestry
Miscellaneous or unknown urban features
An engineered linear bypass feature that redirects a watercourse around a mining feature such as a tailings pond
A linear cleared area through undeveloped land, used for line-of-sight surveying; impossible to distinguish whether associated with quartz or placer mining (overlapping or unclear claims information)
A linear cleared area through undeveloped land, used for line-of-sight surveying; associated with placer mining (identified using claims information and/or other indicators)
A linear cleared area through undeveloped land, used for line-of-sight surveying; associated with quartz mining (identified using claims information and/or other indicators)
A long, narrow excavation dug to expose vein or ore structure
Unknown linear mining disturbance
Visible pipeline or pipeline Right-of-Way (above- or below-ground)
Seismic lines
A driveway in a rural area
A fence in a rural area
A linear feature that is assumed to be an access road, but could also be a trail
A road or narrow passage whose primary function is to provide access for resource extraction (i.e. mining, forestry) and may also have served in providing public access to the backcountry
A major thoroughfare with medium to large traffic capacity

A low-speed thoroughfare, provides access to front of properties, including those with potential public restrictions such as trailer parks, First Nations land, private estate, seasonal residences, gravel pits (NRN definition for Local Street/Local Strata/Local Unknown). Shows signs of regular use.
For Road Rights as attributed in the land parcels ancillary data
Path or track (typically <1.5 m wide) used for walking, cycling, ORV, or other backcountry activities. (Note: trails used for mining activities are Access Roads.)
Dirt or gravel road (typically >1.5 m wide) that does not necessarily access remote resources
PV added 2023-11-28
PV added 2023-11-28; Diversion Channel, Unknown NRN
A right of way with unknown industry type

A linear cleared area through undeveloped land, used for line-of-sight surveying. A cutline may not always be associated with mineral exploration, therefore, Type: Unknown was used to differentiate all cutlines that were outside of mineral exploration.
Unclassified, or unable to identify type based on imagery, but suspected to be anthropogenic
Corridor usually running parallel to highway, where transmission lines or other utilities are visible
Unknown linear feature assumed to be a utility corridor; ancillary data is unclear
